title: Filter button UI changes
description:
UI changes made to the Filter button.
Removed the lightning icon.
Set a pill background for the button.
Removed the Cancel Filter button.
When a filter is selected, clicking on it will unselect it and switch back to default "Filters".

**Primary Reviewer:** @<F4DA52B5-E946-63FC-B2C9-5AFA4A03F715> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Notice absence of Lightning icon near the filter button 
2. Click on the button, pick a filter in menu dropdown (e.g. : Flagged)
3. Notice absence of Cancer Filter ("X") button
4. Click on "Flagged"
5. Notice that there is no menu dropdown and the selected filter is reset


**Feature Flag(s):** 
* TOOLBAR_REFRESH


**Screenshots:** 
|Before|After|
|---|---|
|![Screenshot_1573450422.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/364524/attachments/Screenshot_1573450422%20(2).png =250x) |![filterIcon.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/364524/attachments/filterIcon%20(2).png =250x)|

title: Fix for Bundle Expired deletes HxAccounts
description:
Currently, Bundle Expired flow has check to wipe database to see is there any account in the app but actually it should check if there is no HxAccount in the app then only wipe the database.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<84043D56-522F-4554-AF3D-ADD955DB8CCE> @<AB4C2AF1-97A6-456D-9EB8-42DE8617DE16> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add AC/Hx accounts
2. Debug Settings --> Accounts Playground --> Trigger Bundle Expired.
3. It should only delete the AC accounts. 
4. Follow the same steps only with HxAccounts.
5. It should not delete the HxAccounts.

title: Local calendar write > default attendee type
description:
Google calendar writes the default attendee request type as `TYPE_REQUIRED`. We were writing `TYPE_OPTIONAL` as the default, but we should write `TYPE_REQUIRED` as the default for parity.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Create a local calendar event from outlook
2. Look at the event from the sidekick app
3. Look at the attendees table from the sidekick app, and look at the attendee corresponding to that event ID
4. Verify that the `attendeeType` is `1 (TYPE_REQUIRED)`

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes (updated)

**Feature Flag(s):**
* Local calendar write

title: Local calendars write > Fixing all day recurring event write
description:
For writing local events - the local calendar stack writes the event exception to the wrong day (the day before) if it is an all day recurring event exception, this PR fixes this by undoing the change that changes the date for Hx/AC stacks, and also making the read consistent for both `EventOccurrence` and `Event` objects

**Note** that there is a fundamental difference between how outlook handles all day events and how the android calendar handles all day events:
- outlook:
  - allDay = true
  - startTime = 12am UTC
  - endTime = startTime
- android:
  - allDay = true
  - startTime = 12am UTC
  - endTime = startTime + 1 day (12am UTC)

This was causing a bug where all day events weren't displayed correctly for local events. This bug is also fixed in this PR.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. create a recurring series of all-day events
2. attempt to create an exception of an event in the series (change the title or some field other than the date/time)
3. verify that the exception is saved correctly and viewed correctly via the sidekick app and the google calendar app
4. Do the same with non-allday series
5. Do the same with non-recurring all day events
6. Same for non-recurring non-allday events

Also to test all day end:
1. go to draft event activity by clicking the create new event button
2. toggle the all day switch to on
3. verify that the duration is shown as "1 day"
4. save the event and view the event - verify that the duration is "1 day" and the start/end times are correct
5. repeat for all other stacks

**Unit Tests Added:** yes

**Feature Flag(s):** 
* Local calendar write

title: refactor adviews for integration of xandr sdk | <WIP>
description:
Refactored AdviewHolder and Addataholder for the integration of xandr sdk
1) Create a factory to get adviewholder or dataholder
2) For facebook we inflate the Media at runtime and for rest we inflate imageview 
3) For facebook we have a different layout, as its parent should be NativeAdlayout

title: 3729219 Refresh dnd statuses for all accounts
description:
With multiple accounts connected, we are only starting the `DndStatusLoader` to only load the dnd status for the currently selected account, therefore other accounts with dnd enabled would not show the 💤icon on the AccountButton.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<B125ADD8-FBE7-4A46-8F8B-50075E2B8A05> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Connect multiple accounts
2. Enable DND for all the accounts
3. Restart the app
4. Open the drawer
5. Observe that all account buttons have the orange 💤icon

**Screenshots:** [Remove this section if n/a]
|Before|After|
|---|---|
|![device-2019-10-22-173729.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/353987/attachments/device-2019-10-22-173729.png) |![device-2019-10-22-172715.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/353987/attachments/device-2019-10-22-172715.png)

title: Display only one "Attach files" menu in full compose landscape
description:
Fix "Attach Files" option appearing twice in full compose menu when the display is in landscape mode.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<B125ADD8-FBE7-4A46-8F8B-50075E2B8A05> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Turn the combined file picker feature flag **ON**
2. Compose a new message
3. Tap the paperclip icon: a menu with 2 options should be displayed
4. Switch the device to landscape mode
5. Tap `...` menu in the top right corner of the screen: observe that only 1 menu item is titled 'Attach files'
6. Tap`Attach files` in the above menu -> observe that there are 2 options in this menu
7. Turn the combined file picker feature flag **OFF**
8. Compose a new message
9. Tap the paperclip icon: a menu with 3 options should be displayed
10. Switch the device to landscape mode
11. Tap `...` menu in the top right corner of the screen: observe that only 1 menu item is titled 'Attach files'
12. Tap `Attach files` in the above menu -> observe that there are 3 options in this menu

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
* `Compose v2` (set to **ON**)
* `Combined file picker`

**Screenshots:**
|Before|After|
|---|---|
|![before.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/353918/attachments/before.png) |![after.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/353918/attachments/after.png) |

description:

2. Navigate to the search page

title: Add 3S bookmark answer to search
description:
This PR adds support for the bookmark answer in search. To do that, we need to add a temporary substrate client to talk to 3S directly to get the answer when Hx is not ready. And we need a new Auth resource to get the token to call 3S API for answer.

**Changes:**
1. Add a new Auth resource to retrieve token for 3S API
2. Add a temporary HTTP client to call 3S API directly
3. Integrate bookmark answer card to the search UI behind feature flag

**Primary reviewers:** 
@<09950D56-B98F-4EC7-BAFE-CB42AC4E8626> @<D8100E5C-30B5-692D-B3DA-89448A4D57EE> 

**Test steps:**
1. Turn on feature flag
2. Navigate to search page
3. Search for "hrweb" or "onboarding"

**Feature flags:**
Search bookmark answer

**Screenshots:**
![image.png](https://office.visualstudio.com/2003b897-e349-46b6-a733-61b32410d686/_apis/git/repositories/28406b7c-4cef-44f1-bb35-15e73d905ffb/pullRequests/351409/attachments/image%20(2).png) 

**Todos:**
- [x] Add feature flags
- [x] Sync up with designer on OutlookGray color
- [x] Investigate and fix the threading issue
- [x] Add 3S warm up call

title: [folderingContactSearch] Merge ranked results into contacts
description:
Merge "Ranked" results into "Contacts" section.

Because users wouldn't understand what "Ranked" is

**Primary Reviewer:** @<1B6CE7EC-EE06-6C86-B621-CA25EA571DA6> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Enable "folderingContactSearch" ff
2. Search for a query with unique(not duplicate with local contacts and GAL) ranked contacts results
3. Click "Contacts>" header

**before patch:**
There are results in "Ranked" section

**after patch:**
All results in "Ranked" section moved into "Contacts"

**Screenshots:** [Remove this section if n/a]

title: Provide Aria cross-tenant events with OM default metadata
description:
Partner teams need to send Aria data to their own tenants, and that data needs to have default OM properties appended. The data also need to be controlled by the upcoming privacy settings. Update the LPC/Feed Aria logger to be more generic and include OTGeneralProperties.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<8A946417-8053-4C57-9349-4BF2333ADE6B> 

**Test Steps:**
1. enable aria logcat
2. set logcat filter to capture 'aria' (or AlternateTenantAriaEventLogger)
3. open a person card (click the name in an email header)
4. observe LPC events in logcat
5. observe LPC events indicate tenant a1bde8e78ab14b6198caa18be9d3126e-9277d376-40b1-48ec-92f5-b2ee3f44345b-7212 (instead of one of the OM tenants from AriaEventLogger.ANALYTICS_TOKEN_*).
6. observe LPC events include OM properties such as build_number and supported_abis

title: [Commute] Mail player UI
description:
Add Commute mail player UI for spike and explore possible difficulties in implementing UI elements.
- Dummy email data comes from default Inbox
- Use Android TTS to read subject of emails
- Show left and right swip action as left and right buttons
- Visually mark email as read/archived/flagged... (Will not actually take effect)
- Click on the voice button brings up a dialog, let you choose dummy voice commands
- React to some basic dummy voice commands, like "mark as read", "skip", "reply"
- Shows a reply UI but will not pick up voice

**Primary Reviewer:** @<1B6CE7EC-EE06-6C86-B621-CA25EA571DA6> @<804C2799-5B80-6D7C-BEAF-0CACF41BC1E9> @<B2A688F8-E167-6014-882F-173439DAFB89>

**Test Steps:**
1. Enable "play emails" ff and refresh UI
2. Open drawer when in message list UI
3. Click "play" button


**Screenshots:**

description:

1. Install version **without** my changes from release branch
1. Go to Settings-> Swipe actions-> Select "Delete" option without icon
1. Observer crash, repeat previous step
1. Observe action is set to "Delete"
1. Go to Mail->Swipe left/ right, should be no crashes

1. Install version **with** my changes from release branch
1. Go to Settings-> Swipe actions.
1. Observer action is set to Archive/SetUpActions/Schedule
1. Go to Mail->Swipe left/ right, should be no crashes

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: fix context description
description:
AccountPickerView has supports two different adapters - ToolbarAccountAdapter which displays email address as title and account name as subtitle and ContentAccountAdapter which does the opposite. So, when we include ALL_ACCOUNT_ID with ToolbarAccountAdapter we populate the email address with all_accounts_name and when we include ALL_ACCOUNT_ID with ContentAccountAdapter we populate the account name with all_accounts_name.

However getContentDescription is expecting to find the ALL_ACCOUNT_ID in the display name. Instead of hard-coding this, we should just look first for the email address and then for the display name and use the first one we can find as the description.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<D8100E5C-30B5-692D-B3DA-89448A4D57EE> 

**Test Steps:**
1. Add multiple accounts to the app.
2. Turn on talkback.
3. Navigate to the 'Search 'tab item and activate it
4. Navigate to the search edit field and activate it
5. Navigate on to the account dropdown and listen to the announcement

Nearby cases include
1. The announcement of the account dropdown when an individual account is selected
2. The announcement of the account dropdown in the do not disturb settings (requires turning on the "do not disturb refresh" and rebooting the app) both with all accounts selected and an individual account selected.

**Unit Tests Added:** No

title: [Commute] Store Commute settings options in Shared Preferences
description:

title: [Add-ins][Online Meeting Integration]To get TEE conferenceInfo Extended Property via Hx sync.
description:
Earlier we were making REST call to sync TEE conferenceInfo Extended Property for particular event. 
Now Hx has provided this property as a part of HxAppointmentBody. So join experience will be much faster as we don't need to make a call for REST API.

**Primary Reviewer:** @<276EDC7F-E1BA-6850-A416-55A830BC5BD0> @<EFACD530-5E35-4A40-A9C5-44F76613AFE9> 

**Test Steps:**
Step 1: login with given Hx Account , it already has BlueJeans Meeting add-in installed.
Step 2: enable below given feature flag of online meeting integration and restart app.
feature flag:  Addins Online Meeting Integration
step 3: open calendar and create event, UI should be similar to attached screenshot .
step 4: add meeting details, enable BlueJeans Meeting toggle 
Expected behavior:  Bluejeans add-in shall get launched in the background and online meeting link and description should get added in description,  after the add-in execution is successful. The toggle button should also be in on state. has been added to the description, send it.

step 5: After syncing from server, Open the meeting created using bluejeans add-in and check if JOIN button comes up.
Expected Behavior: JOIN button to be shown and on tapping the JOIN, the user should be taken to browser or if bluejeans app is already installed then the App. 

**Unit Tests Added:** No

**Feature Flag(s):**
* Flag 1  **Addins Online Meeting Integration**

Updating `EventNotificationJob` to support multiple reminder notifications. Prior to this PR it just picked the first reminder

2. Add a local event with multiple reminders (from google calendar)
3. Add that calendar as a local calendar in outlook

5. Verify that you still get notifications for HX and AC stacks

**Unit Tests Added:** No

* localCalendarNotifications

title: Convert `EventReminder` to `String`
description:
We should return the same string for local events and other events with the same `alertMinutes`

**Changes:**
1. Add some comments
2. Add a method `getAllDayReminderAlertStringMulti()` to convert `EventReminder` to `String` for local all day event
3. If `reminder.getReminderInMinutes() == 0`, return "At time of event" instead of ""
4. If `reminder.getReminderInMinutes() == -1`, return "None" instead of ""

**Primary Reviewer:** @<EF490E68-9367-6FD6-866C-38B37516F84F> @<43C04179-FCDA-61C3-B0F6-A1DC2742566A> @<2108F300-2AB6-4F2F-BC9C-06B838BD629B> 

**Unit Tests Added:** Yes

**Related PR:**
!352675

**Test steps:**
1. Create a new branch based on `yangw/eventReminderToString`, then merge branch `yangw/supportMultipleEventReminders` to this new branch
2. Enable feature flag "LocalCalendarsWrite"
3. Create local event, and observe alert of the event remains the same in `DraftEventActivity` and `EventDetailsFragment`
